website_summaries.verdict: Set provides a solid heavy-duty lighting option for longer trailers.
pros: Rated for use with trailers over 80 feet in length
Also can be used with shorter units
Decent replacement lights that work very well
Rectangular design offers a better fit for some trailers
cons: The wire length that comes with this set is a little short

customer_reviews.title: great product but light leaked. May need extra waterproofing.
customer_reviews.text: Installed lights no problem. First time i backed down the boat ramp one of the lights filled with water. I guess i plan to add some silicone around the seams to help water proof it more. I dont really have original packaging to return. Total bummer being that i paid extra for the submersible kind.
customer_reviews.author: Beau Manning

customer_reviews.title: Great lights, BUT the screws holding the red exterior ...
customer_reviews.text: Great lights, BUT the screws holding the red exterior reflector lens ARE NOT STAINLESS, and should be replaced with stainless ones of similar size (less than $2 at most hardware stores for 8) when you instal the lights. Otherwise you'll find these screws totally rusted out and will fall apart, clogging the screw holes in the plastic) when you try to unscrew them to inspect the LEDS in any trouble shooting effort. Not much of a problem, since the lights are sealed and they're super bright... but, really annoying at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Customer who Bought it

customer_reviews.title: Great buy if you can catch them on sale.
customer_reviews.text: Well I was disappointed these weren't a direct bolt on to my 1996 shorelander boat trailer, but maybe I was expecting too much with that. I had to use the lights on opposite sides(passenger to driver side and vice versa). I have to stick my own reflectors($4) on the end now to be DOT compliant but it saves me the hassle of drilling four new holes in my trailer. The LEDs are very bright, brake, turn, and running. Don't use the wire nuts provided. Instead I'd suggest soldering the leads and using heat shrink. Came with a wire harness too. These can be installed within an hour timeframe.
customer_reviews.author: akt

customer_reviews.title: Work well in harsh submerged environment - Recommended
customer_reviews.text: These lights have worked out well in a submersible boat trailer application - this after the failure of non-submersible LED trailer lights in the past. Do NOT use non-submersible LED lights thinking the LED aspect is protective of water intrusion and failure - they will fail and you will have to come back to this product for a successful result. Installing trailer lights ease is dependent upon your trailer - I found these to be easy to install with use of a an electrician's fish tape to get the wires through trailer pieces to the tow vehicle plug area.
customer_reviews.author: DavidMVermont

customer_reviews.title: Looked great until 1 of them flooded and died...
customer_reviews.text: One already flooded and died, the other seems to be holding on well so far, it must have had a crack somewhere which led it to flood.... I had to remove the whole electronics board and use customized LED modules, so I ended up using the plastic box! the main plastic box can be easily sealed with Silicon to add another layer of protection, but I guess it will cost them more money which will increase the price...That is what I would do if I decided to buy them. I shipped them all the way to Dubai...
customer_reviews.author: Samer

customer_reviews.title: Good light
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and found they did not fit my Curahee trailer, but a friend who wanted an LED upgrade was gifted these by me. He loves them and I have seen them and they are sharp. The way the did not fit was the top was too tall and my trailer was intended to have rectangles with a slimmer horizontal face. So, if you have an open face to mount to, this would be a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Xander

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my older led trailer tailights that were getting intermittent ...
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my older led trailer tailights that were getting intermittent. One word of advice is if using trailer a lot, especially in salt water, make sure to solder all connections, then shrink wrap tightly. Another thing to eliminate iffy performance is to connect ground wires and run a solid wire forward to plug, instead of just grounding to frame, which gets corroded over time and causes lights to start not working. It's worth the few minutes it takes to do this and saves a lot of frustration in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Molokaipake

customer_reviews.title: Blazer C7423 Submersible LED Trailer Light Kit works great on my boat trailer
customer_reviews.text: I installed the "Blazer C7423 Submersible LED Trailer Light Kit for Trailers Under 80-Inches Wide" on my pontoon boat trailer used in a salt water bay about a mile form the ocean. Used it to pull my boat out once and so far so good. Lights work fine and no sign of water seeping in. I'll try to update this spring when I put the boat back in the water. Wires were a little short for my trailer so I had to use a trailer wire extender between the trailer and my truck. I used water proof crimps to to connect the harness to the lights.
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement lights! Exact fit for most trailers and they are adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for the price! I shopped this type of light at Walmart and these were considerably cheaper and landed at my campsite in FL within 2 days via Prime. I had busted one on a Waverunner trailer and these were an exact fit replacement. Took me about an hour total to replace (most of that time was b/c I had to straighten the trailer mounting bracket).
customer_reviews.author: Studier

customer_reviews.title: LEDs become dim over time
customer_reviews.text: After two seansons of being used half of the LEDs on one of the lights are so dim they are basically not functioning. Similar in appearance to what you see on older LED-based trafic lights: some bulbs are bright and clear, some are dim and dark.
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: upon closer inspection I discovered a crack in the lens which caused the leak. I don't know if it was cracked when I received it or after it was put in service. The manufacturer sent me a replacement and it has been perfect. ORIGINAL REVIEW: Filled with water and stopped working after 2 months. Was used in fresh water only. I would not recommend this product, it was a waste of money..
customer_reviews.author: Kev840

customer_reviews.title: Ordered this, but got lights by "Hopkins Towing Solutions" instead
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've gotten these Blazer lights. The first time, they worked great for a few years until the axle on the trailer snapped and took the lights out with it. I ordered them again, but received LED submersible lights by Hopkins instead. As far as I can tell, they are the same kit - probably even made by one company for the other - but i suppose time will tell. 4 Stars for now based on not receiving the same brand as ordered; may update if I remember if they perform the same.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trailer lights
customer_reviews.text: So far they are working great. We use our boat mostly at night and it is great being able to leave the trailer lights plugged up so you can use the trailer lights to center the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Submerse These Lights!!!
customer_reviews.text: For products like this I like to wait a year or so to see how well the hold up. This product did not... period. The right side running light all burnt but two and half the break lights went out. On the right side all of the break lights are done and half of the running lights. Although they are titled as "submersible" I highly recommend not putting these on a boat trailer. After less than 12 boat launchings they both need to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: NuForce

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I prefer to stick to the “name brand” lights for my trailers. Have installed these on two works trailers that go out on the road everyday and have had no issues after almost two years.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, trailer wires were long enough for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy install, trailer wires were long enough for my 16' boat trailer, everything bolted up as it should have and works, has only been dunked in the lake on on trip so far but everything worked afterward just like it did right after install. The Main tail/brake light lens does have kind of an orangeish look to it like has been mentioned in other reviews, but lens carries the D.O.T. approval molded into it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Conley

customer_reviews.title: The light colors are not right. The break light is yellow
customer_reviews.text: Thea’s lights are not correct on the colors configuration. I installed them and found out after that the center large lens is yellow or orange. Not red. It is actually the break light as well. I pretty sure the break light always has to be red. The the lens on the end is just red. That one should be the turn signal. The also do not have a back up light.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: Kit was easy to install, provides high visiblty; works great. I HATE BEING FORCED TO PROVIDE TEN UNNECESSARY ADDITIONAL WORDS.
customer_reviews.author: Dave & Jane Potter

customer_reviews.title: Probably not!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two sets of these lights. (one from retail store and the other Amazon) The "right", or passenger side fixture failed to operate from both sets of lights. Two failures out of two light sets. I did return the lights to Amazon and retail store traded my defective fixture for one that did work. I have no idea what to expect in terms of longevity, but appears quality control issues from my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Locher

customer_reviews.title: Overall these work fine, but it makes sense to match LED color ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I knew BEFORE I installed them... but the LED's are white, through a red lens. That doesn't make much sense to me, as you get reduced light output through a colored lens. I had a similar set of lights on my last trailer... but they were red LED's through a red lens... much brighter. Overall these work fine, but it makes sense to match LED color to lens color.
customer_reviews.author: spoon059

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: The right one only lasted 2 years. The LEDs on the tail/turn/brake portion went extremely dim (not visible whatsoever during the day). Not a wiring problem because I tested it, and also the side marker portion still worked.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Functions very well.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, no issues so far. I wish there was a way to block off the light provided for the license plate, as I do not need a license plate on the small boat trailer I use them on. Grounding to the frame was awkward, but I made it work. I have submerged the lights launching the boat many times with power connected and have had zero issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R. Olenski

customer_reviews.title: Huge Upgrade For Your Trailer
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were very clear and easy to follow for installing these on my 8' x 5' utility trailer. I am relatively handy, but had never done wiring on a trailer before. It took an hour or two to complete, but was well worth it. The lights are nice and bright, which were a huge upgrade over the old stock ones. Being marine-grade is an added bonus for durability. These have been on my trailer for approx. a year now and still work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Also found that you really need a good ground for both lights and the main plug
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace old lights on a small utility trailer. These were taller than the original lights so had to rig a bracket to lower them a little. That was my fault. Also found that you really need a good ground for both lights and the main plug. Paint will interfere with that ground so sanded down to bare metal and they work beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: T. Neill

customer_reviews.title: Instructions were good, wires were plenty long
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were good, wires were plenty long, hardware was decent and the lights themselves were very bright, put these on a boat trailer and left them on underwater to test them. Passed with flying colors. Nice that I don't have to worry about these anymore. Wish they made the oval ones for my snowmobile trailer at I'd buy from them again!
customer_reviews.author: M. Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and look really nice
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation and look really nice. It's so convenient not having to worry anymore about disconnecting the lights before backing the boat in so that bulbs won't get blown.
customer_reviews.author: txphil

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Only used about a month and a half on boat trailer, one side is dead. Junk. Edit: and as another reviewer mentioned, the brake/tail section is more amber than red. Probably not legal.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: good led replacement for my utility trailer
customer_reviews.text: Lights are bright; easy install. The ground wire is a bit odd because it is only a short distance run from the plug and so that needed to be lengthened to attach to the trailer to ground the lights. It should be at least 3 feet but it was perhaps 10 inches. No big deal because I just added a length. My set went bad and this is a good replacement at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: B. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Blazer Clear Lens LED trailer lights
customer_reviews.text: Mounted these on my boat trailer that I was rewiring. Great product, bright lights and easy to install. Strongly recommend these for anyone that wants lights that can be submerged without fear of blowing your lights out. I was a little disappointed in the wiring harness as the wire insulation was very cheap. Recommend buying a harness with a little better wire insulation as these will not last long if used. I bought a heavy duty wire harness and that did the trick. Otherwise this light set is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J. Coplin SR

customer_reviews.title: More Asian junk
customer_reviews.text: I read a review stating that the connectors were on the wrong cables. Thought it was a fluke, it wasn't. I was forced to connect to my old wiring until I can get the correct wiring harness locally. Probably just as well as the wiring in the kit is a much lighter gauge than the old wiring.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen L. Strelow

customer_reviews.title: An incredible deal, however, upon installation and checking ...
customer_reviews.text: An incredible deal, however, upon installation and checking the lights for operation I discovered the following: the outboard running light is red. The center, 6 LED light section is orange. Don't know in which country you are hoping to sell these things, but here in the USof A, tail lights are supposed to be red. Turn signals can be orange (yellow). In the photos where the product is advertised, the LED's appear to be all red, as one would expect. But, surprise!, they are orange!
customer_reviews.author: mustangcorral

customer_reviews.title: Perfect kit for a trailer rebuild. Comes with everything you need.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality lights. Its nice that kit comes with everything needed to wire up trailer completely. Brightness is much better than incandescant. It has side running lights on the housing and a nice bright license plate light. Would not hesitate to purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: DIY DadTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for your old light set
customer_reviews.text: Great upgrade for your old light set. Use your old wiring to pull New harness through frame. Solder all connections and shrink wrap or dap with sealer to keep water out. Very bright
customer_reviews.author: Martin P Koenig

customer_reviews.title: Installation was easy, however
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy, however, there was a small crack in one of the edge lights, a little silicone fixed it, I've submerged the trailer many times over the last few months, and they're great still, also, very bright. Wish the ground wire at the hitch came with a grounding ring and was slightly longer.
customer_reviews.author: mrmessma

customer_reviews.title: Super-bright LED trailer lights!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to go on my 2001 Tennessee boat trailer, to replace the ancient incandescent units on it - one of which was not even operational. i really like the brightness of these LED units. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: North Georgia Hawg

customer_reviews.title: after a while one out of two lamps did not survive submersion on a boat trailer
customer_reviews.text: after carefully being installed on a boat trailer for 7 months, the passenger side lamp started taking on water a little at a time until all leds were no longer working. not much for a life cycle. will be shopping for another brand replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Dee B.

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes you don't get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this product! 1. It is not a product that can be used in salt water. 2. None of the mounting or electrical hardware is stainless. 3. There are no lock washers or star washers to keep the mounting hardware from loosening. 4. My trailer is for my 20' Mako. The wiring harness is 4-5' short on each side. I will need to spice 4 pieces of wire to make it work. The lights are great if that's all you need.
customer_reviews.author: K Beal

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Lights!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These lights are awsome!!! Slick looking and bright!!! The wire that came witht he kit was ok... had to add a few feet.. Did not and will not ever use the cheap wire connectors that they send!!! Thats a big problem with trailers, the cheap wire connectors that are used that corrode and cause problems like the lights to stop working or short out! Spend a few extra dollars and use the connectors that have shrink tubing made on them! I recommend these lights!
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: Big Improvement
customer_reviews.text: Like the lights and they're a great improvement. Have only had them on for one trip of about 6 hrs. Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: djloe07

customer_reviews.title: Good set, make sure to heat shrink your connections ...
customer_reviews.text: Good set, make sure to heat shrink your connections for longevety. Would give 5 stars but price on Amazon is higher then local retailers. Three months of use on a boat trailer in salt water no issues as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: Faith or Val

customer_reviews.title: Great trailer LED light kit!
customer_reviews.text: This LED trailer light kit looks amazing! They are 10 times brighter than incandescent trailer lights that I have used in the past! I drop my boat trailer in saltwater once a week and it still works great. I use to buy my trailer lights (non LED) at West Marine and they would fail after three to four dunks in saltwater. I would stop wasting your money on cheap incandescent trailer lights. They are not made to last! I will update this review in 12 months.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Fair product
customer_reviews.text: They are perfect for what they are, an inexpensive tail light solution. The test will come once they've been dipped in salt water a few times. However the wire gauge harness should be one gauge larger and for a boat trailer it should be tinned copper stranded wire not just bare copper.
customer_reviews.author: deddy

customer_reviews.title: Enlighten
customer_reviews.text: Perfect lights! Bright and no more bulbs to break/burn out or replace.
customer_reviews.author: Critic

customer_reviews.title: I am sold, Best Value, Complete kit.
customer_reviews.text: Comes with everything I needed to add lights to my hitch carrier. Bright LEDs wiring, bolts, nuts connectors and wow instructions too. Great price and a test demo switch too. If I had paid half as much, I would have gotten half as much.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Lots of parts and pieces (small wire nuts, splicing ...
customer_reviews.text: Lots of parts and pieces (small wire nuts, splicing clips, lots of wire) you'll need to either retrofit an existing installation or go new. Hopefully the lights will outlast the trailer they're bolted to.
customer_reviews.author: wrxboxy

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, easy to install and bright
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, easy to install and bright. Only gave 4 stars because the wires coming off the lights were only 8 inches long. Wish those wires were longer so you have more options for hiding the connections. With such short wires, I was not able to hide the connections.
customer_reviews.author: Hog Wash

customer_reviews.title: A really nice upgrade for a great price, easy installation
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy, though I did use waterproof heat-shrinkable connectors instead of the included twist type connectors. I'm glad I went with the low profile style. I wish the license plate bracket had holes for the smaller license plates, but it wasn't a big deal to drill them. They're much brighter than the old lights and if they're actually submersible, I'll be really happy. I'll probably replace my other boat trailers with these lights as well. For the price, it's a great upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: seastormTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: faster & better than what we could find in the islands
customer_reviews.text: Bought while on vacation, fishing with friends, when lights went out on his boat trailer, & being in the FL keys, was easier, cheaper, faster & better than what we could find in the islands. Saved the great time we were having.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to replace if you break one.
customer_reviews.text: They work great, but if you break one, it’s hard to find a replacement. You can’t just buy a cap like others from blazer
customer_reviews.author: Furniture maker

customer_reviews.title: Look great, very bright and easy install but 3 LEDS ...
customer_reviews.text: Look great, very bright and easy install but 3 LEDS are out on right already after two trips. Still fine but hope no more go out.
customer_reviews.author: Roger C Parker

customer_reviews.title: Very bright
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, I have only been to the river a few times since installing these on my boat trailer. They are bright and seem like they will work for a long time
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Upon opening the package and reviewing the part the biggest ...
customer_reviews.text: Upon opening the package and reviewing the part the biggest thing I noticed is the hardware has no corrosive protection on them at all. Bolts were ordinary steal and would be rusting soon as my trailer sits outside. I replaced all the installation hardware with galvanized hardware, soldered electrical connections as well as applied heat shrink to the wires. The lights are plenty bright enough and seem to work well. Hopefully they last as long as my hardware :-)
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Baum

customer_reviews.title: they are by far the best taillight kit to get
customer_reviews.text: I have gotten these for 2 different trailers, they are by far the best taillight kit to get. I'll buy them for my other 2 trailers when it's time to replace those.
customer_reviews.author: Darren H

customer_reviews.title: I recommend buying an aftermarket license plate holder
customer_reviews.text: Was forced to put these well below the waterline of my boat trailer. Left it in the water overnight last month & the seals are holding. I recommend buying an aftermarket license plate holder. The plastic one provided wont last. I got a steel one for like $8.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G

customer_reviews.title: Not street legal
customer_reviews.text: Amber lights with red filter. Not street legal. Wire too short and frail.
customer_reviews.author: Me-OfCourse

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. We got tired of replacing bulbs on our boat trailer and bought these LED lights. They work perfectly and save us the hassle and time to replace the old style bulbs. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Davies

customer_reviews.title: Truly submersible boat trailer lights
customer_reviews.text: LED submersible boat trailer lights are the only way to go, the other type that claim to be submersible the bulb an socket get submerged and eventually the hot light bulb hit the cold water and breaks or the socket rusts and you loose your electrical connection, The only draw back with the Kit was the small gauge wire that I did not use. Buying it trough Amazon I save time from running around looking for the bigger type needed for larger boat trailers, not all automotive store carry the bigger LED type. update: one of the lights stopped working after a year,I had to replace it, but I still will go with this type
customer_reviews.author: F. Foreman

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I bought a $30 set first and they ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I bought a $30 set first and they were trash in less than two weeks. These have been on point so far.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great tail lights.
customer_reviews.text: These lights were easy to install and create a bright light. So far they have been waterproof. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Honk honk
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with the product. It was easy to install on my old trailer and has so far held up well. The lights are highly visible and completely sealed. I expect they will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Olson

customer_reviews.title: very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: very easy to install, shipping was prompt. waited to do a review because of some others i have read. the running light and brake light on the left side has went half way out after a few weeks of use. not sure if the product is under warranty or not, i plan to check into getting a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good trailer lights.
customer_reviews.text: Thin wiring and they don't run the ground wire all the way to from the plug to the lights. They are nice and bright. Haven't tested the water proof qualities yet.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, super bright and made my utility trailer look new again. The old incandescent lamps on our trailer just weren't bright enough and it seemed like the bulbs would burn out a few times a year. The Blazer LED's have been on our trailer for a year now and covered a few thousand miles with no problems or malfunctions. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Customer in Sacramento, CA

customer_reviews.title: Great lights! Only issue I have is that the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great lights! Only issue I have is that the wiring harness that came with them wasn't long enough to replace my current wiring, quite easy to install and replace my existing lights. Be aware though that if you have tight tolerances on the trailer with current lights you might have to modify the trailer!
customer_reviews.author: Art Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great lights! Not long enough harness.
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I didn't give this a 5 star is due to the fact that the wiring harness wasn't quite long enough for my bost trailer. My boat is 17 feet long. I had to splice up front to make it long enough to reach my plug on my truck. Very easy to install. LED lights are nice a bright Would recommend. Just wish harness was another 3 feet longer
customer_reviews.author: Travis Tyler

customer_reviews.title: A bright idea to get them
customer_reviews.text: Work well and without problems. Much brighter than incandescent bulbs I've had in the past. Long wires allow for good positions and installation was a breeze
customer_reviews.author: Cheff Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy unless you want to do it twice
customer_reviews.text: At first these lights were slim. Easy to install. But a month later (just outside the return window) one light completely stopped working while the other only 25% of the leds work. And this was all before it hit the water. My advice, don’t take the cheap route unless you want to do the job more than once.
customer_reviews.author: Joe D.

customer_reviews.title: LED were the best I've ever seen
customer_reviews.text: LED were the best I've ever seen. Thought I would have these on my trailer for a good long time but once I dipped these in water about 8-10 times...big time FAIL. LED lights started to fail one by one. Now all the lights are pretty non-existent. Guess I'll try another brand.

customer_reviews.title: Great trailer lights
customer_reviews.text: These are working great on my boat trailer. Very bright!

customer_reviews.text: Great lights. Direct replacement for the bulb lights I had on my trailer and therefore made the installation very quick.

customer_reviews.text: Nice lights. Very bright and an exact fit replacement for the ones (another brand) already on my featherlite trailer.

customer_reviews.text: nice lights but to big for my trailer . had to return them. No problem with the return. Told them of my problem and they sent a return lable.

customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal on LED light source. Easily replaced trailer lights.These are much better visually than older style tail light bulbs.

product_meta.title: Blazer C7280 LED Low Profile Submersible Trailer Light Kit
product_meta.description: Style:LED_Rectangular Low Profile SubmersibleThe Blazer C7280 LED low-profile submersible trailer light kit is designed to conform to applicable US FMVSS108 and Canadian CMVSS safety standards for trailers over and under 80" wide. The driver’s side features a combination of 8-function stop, tail, turn, rear and side reflex, rear clearance and side marker and license illumination functions. The passenger side has the same functions as the driver’s side with the exception of the license plate light. This kit is not only ideal for boat trailers, but for any utility, camping, snowmobile and motorcycle trailer where LED lights are desired. The life of an LED trailer light far exceeds traditional incandescent trailer lights. Lenses are sonically sealed to provide protection from moisture and corrosion. Additionally, all electronics are potted with water resistant epoxy for a second layer of defense. These stop/tail/turn lights are individually replaceable with model numbers C7288TM and C7298TM. The kit includes (2) submersible stop/tail/turn lights, wire harness, license plate bracket, mounting hardware, and trilingual instructions, everything needed for easy installation and DOT compliance.
feature_bullets: LED low-profile submersible trailer light kit
Universal, easy surface mounting on 2" or 4" mounting center
Electronics are epoxy coated for a second layer of defense against moisture and corrosion
8-functions: stop, tail, turn, rear and side reflex, rear clearance, side marker and license illumination
